title: The world begins welcoming 2025 with light shows, embraces and ice plunges
byline: From Sydney to Vladivostok, communities around the world have begun welcoming 2025 with spectacular light shows, embraces and ice plunges.

title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya, Polonnaruwa, Hambantota and Matara districts.

title: President hails 2025 as dawn of a new era for Sri Lanka
byline: As Sri Lanka ushers in 2025, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has expressed optimism about the nation’s future, calling it the dawn of a new era where the long-cherished dreams of prosperity are beginning to materialize.

title: Prime Minister Harini calls for unity and progress in 2025
byline: As Sri Lanka enters 2025, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya highlighted the transformative journey of the past year and the renewed hope for the nation’s future.

title: Launch of ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ national initiative
byline: The launch of the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ national initiative commenced under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat, a short while ago.

title: Emirates to Increase Flights to Sri Lanka in 2025
byline: Emirates will increase flight frequencies on its Dubai-Colombo route in 2025, increasing passenger capacity on the Sri Lanka service by 30 percent.

title: Colombo Stock Market achieves nearly 50% growth in 2024
byline: The Colombo Stock Market has achieved a 49.66% growth in the year 2024.

title: New year, new political culture: President Dissanayake outlines vision for Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the challenge of giving the new year a new transformation lies squarely with the government.

title: US imposes sanctions on Russian and Iranian groups over disinformation targeting American voters
byline: The United States has imposed sanctions on two groups linked to Iranian and Russian efforts to target American voters with disinformation ahead of this year’s election.

title: Passengers ‘fly back in time’ on Hong Kong flight
byline: A group of people will have the chance to raise a toast to the New Year twice thanks to crossing the International Date Line (IDL) during their flight.

title: Sri Lanka Customs records historic revenue over Rs 1.5 trillion in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has achieved a landmark revenue of Rs. 1.515 trillion in the year 2024, according to its Media Spokesperson and Additional Director General, Seevali Arukgoda.

title: 20 Indian fishermen released by Sri Lanka return home
byline: The 20 Indian fishermen, who were released from jails in Sri Lanka, reached Chennai by flight, said officials in Chennai on Wednesday (Jan. 01).

title: Spaniard arrested with cocaine and ecstasy pills
byline: The officers of the Galle Unit of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) have arrested a foreign national while in the possession of a stock of narcotics intended for trafficking.

title: Namal Kumara arrested
byline: Social activist Namal Kumara has been arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today (01), the police said.

title: Suspect arrested with illegally assembled vehicles worth over Rs. 50 mln
byline: The Police Fraud Investigation Bureau has successfully dismantled a criminal network involved in illegally assembling and selling vehicles.

title: Astronaut Sunita Williams, colleagues will see 16 sunrises and sunsets on New Year from space
byline: Sunita Williams, Indian-origin NASA astronaut along with her colleagues on the International Space Station (ISS), will have an extraordinary opportunity to welcome the New Year. Sunita Williams, currently in space, will see 16 sunrises and sunsets on New Year as the ISS, where she is located, keeps on the move.

title: Over 7,000 motorists penalized for traffic offenses in 24 hours
byline: In a 24-hour operation that concluded at 6.00 a.m. today (01), Sri Lanka Police have enforced the law against 529 drunk drivers as part of a nationwide effort to minimize traffic accidents during the festive season.

title: ‘Squid Game Season 2’ breaks viewership records with 68 million views in debut week
byline: “Squid Game” Season 2 has topped the viewership charts with a whopping 68 million views in its debut and trending at #1 in 92 countries, breaking the record for the most watched show in its premiere week as well as the most popular list.

title: Social activist Namal Kumara remanded
byline: Social activist Namal Kumara has been ordered to be remanded until January 15, 2025.

title: At least 10 dead after truck crashes into New Orleans crowd, city authorities say
byline: At least 10 people were killed and 30 injured when a truck drove into a large crowd on Bourbon Street in New Orleans’ French Quarter early on Wednesday, a city government agency said.

title: Exams Dept. takes final decision on 2024 Scholarship Exam paper leak
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara says a decision has been made to award free marks to all students for the three questions which were alleged to have been leaked in the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination, as per the recent Supreme Court order.

title: Sri Lanka Police launches e-Traffic mobile app to combat traffic violations
byline: Sri Lanka Police have launched the e-Traffic mobile application, a cutting-edge tool aimed at reducing traffic violations and improving road safety in line with the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative.

title: Vindhya Jayasekera appointed new CEO Designate to CSE
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) announced the appointment of Ms. Vindhya Jayasekera as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Designate, effective from 01 January 2025.
